Why should we shop like this for our health care?

We are reversing the Obama administration‚Äôs regulatory onslaught. And, more fundamentally, we are returning power from unelected bureaucrats in Washington to the states and the People.

Congratulations to Judge Neil Gorsuch on his confirmation to the Supreme Court. I commend President Donald J. Trump on having his nominee confirmed. Justice Scalia‚Äôs seat will now be filled by a judge committed to our Constitution and first principles.

Insurers are leaving Obamacare left and right, leaving many people with only one option. That's not a choice. That's a monopoly. It's time for more competition and lower prices in health care.
The number of Congressional Review Act measures sent to The White House is now up to 13. We will continue to take action to reverse the tide of Obama-era overregulation.

If you wanted to help the military‚Äîwhether it be a pay raise for our soldiers or increased funding for tools and technology‚Äîyou had to match it dollar-for-dollar with domestic spending. Breaking this Obama-era parody is the biggest victory we could have had.

We have one of the worst tax systems in the industrialized world. It's costing us jobs and it's costing us economic growth. We must simplify our tax code to make it easier for American businesses to stay in America and make things in America.

21-Gun Salute from the United States Capitol, in honor of all America‚Äôs peace officers who made the ultimate sacrifice.

Breaking ground on a brand new production facility today in Janesville. Manufacturing is thriving in Wisconsin!

The last time we reformed the tax code was 1986, the year I got my driver's license. The world economy has changed a lot since then, but the American tax system has not kept up. If we want to make things again in America, we've got to reform our tax code.
America's tax code is just so complicated. We are going to simplify it by closing the loopholes and lowering your taxes. People who make the same amount of money should pay the same kind of tax.
America is a nation of winners, but right now the rules are rigged against our workers. You deserve a level playing field. Tax reform will lead to more American jobs and increased wages.
We must be clear. White supremacy is repulsive. This bigotry is counter to all this country stands for. There can be no moral ambiguity.

It is possible to get a good-paying job without going into debt. That's why the House is focused on improving career and technical education. We want to make it easy for people to get the skills they need to obtain a career they love.

Our tax code is currently trapping trillions of dollars in American profits overseas. That's crazy. We need to reform our tax system so that these American companies can reinvest this money back into our economy.

With tax reform, we're going to lower your rates and make it easier to do your taxes by yourself on a form the size of a postcard. We'll do this by raising the standard deduction, reducing the number of tax brackets, and eliminating special-interest loopholes.

In this country, when citizens see each other in need, they step up, and they answer the call. America will emerge from the storm stronger than ever before.

Great meeting with Vice President Mike Pence today. Congress is working side-by-side with The White House to level the playing field for American workers.

Congress agrees with President Donald J. Trump: The middle class are the people who need the tax break. Those living paycheck to paycheck, worried about losing their job or not, who haven‚Äôt gotten a raise in years‚Äîtax reform is about them.

The budget the House passed this week reforms how the federal government spends your money. We must have spending discipline, combined with economic growth, to pay down our national debt.

Trump's administration to promote an energy strategy that gets government out of the business of picking winners and losers and instead encourages all types of energy sources.
It's time to give the middle class a break.

Since the first session of the Continental Congress, our nation's legislature has opened with a prayer to God. Recently, an atheist challenged this practice in court by arguing that a secular invocation should take the place of a religious prayer. Today, the U.S. District Court rejected the challenge and upheld the House's tradition. We will continue to begin each day as we have for centuries: taking a moment to pray to God.
The whole purpose of tax reform is to give middle-income taxpayers a tax cut. Let's simplify the system, close the loopholes, and let you decide what do with your own money.

We‚Äôre facing a choice that‚Äôs central to our country's future: Keep the system rigged, favoring the wealthy and well-connected. OR reform the tax code so that it‚Äôs fair and simple, helping middle class Americans.

Our current tax code is biased against the middle class, and people striving to get there, while the wealthy and well-connected have their prime choice of carveouts. Both parties are to blame. That's why our plan for tax reform aims to make the code more fair.

Good news ‚Üí The House just unanimously passed a bill to end the culture of retaliation against whistleblowers at the VA. Protecting whistleblowers at the VA also protects the veterans that they serve, and no one who stands up for our veterans should be marginalized, let alone targeted.
The U.S. tax system is so messed up. It‚Äôs full of special-interest loopholes. We just want to clean it up and simplify the whole thing.

An army of lobbyists will come to protect special interest provisions and derail tax reform. But conservative foot soldiers will see this through because hardworking American families gain nothing if we slip into complacency.

To those that say tax reform is just a tax cut for the rich‚Äîhow original. The irony is our current tax system disproportionately benefits the wealthy. Our plan offers real relief to the middle class.

A candidate for president in 2012 said: ‚ÄúOur current corporate tax system is outdated, unfair, and inefficient. It provides tax breaks for moving jobs and profits overseas and hits companies that choose to stay in America with one of the highest tax rates in the world.‚Äù  No, it wasn't Mitt Romney. It was Barack Obama.

The Obama administration's Iran nuclear agreement is fatally flawed and insufficient. I support President Donald J. Trump's decision to reevaluate this dangerous deal. All this stuff you see on a daily basis about Twitter this and Twitter that, that is not what‚Äôs important. What IS important is the fact that we have a historic chance to actually fix the tax code and increase wages in America. That is what Republicans in the House are focused on.
